vocabinfos.mediumDef:
A man of the tribe of Manasseh living at the time of Egypt and Wilderness, first mentioned at Gen.50.23;
son of: Manasseh (H4519) and Aramitess (H0761);
brother of: Asriel (H0844H); married to Maacah (H4601M);
father of: Gilead (H1568H), daughter_of_Machir (H4353I), Peresh (H6570), Sheresh (H8329) and Hammolecheth (H4447); also called in NIV: Makir
Also named: ma.khi.ri (מָכִירִי "Machirite" H4354)
§ Machir = "sold"
1) eldest son of Manasseh by an Aramite or Syrian concubine and progenitor of a large family
2) son of Ammiel, a powerful chief of one of the Transjordanic tribes who rendered essential services to Saul and to David
vocabinfos._es_Definition: (a)   hombre; hijo de Manasés; padre de Galaad; (b)   hombre; hijo de Amiel
vocabinfos._zh_tw_Definition:
瑪吉 这个陽性專有名詞在希伯來文的意思是 "賣出"
1) 瑪拿西的長子
2) 亞米利之子, 為外約旦支派之一的強大的首領, 並成為掃羅和大衛不可或缺的幫助
vocabinfos._zh_Definition:
玛吉 这个阳性专有名词在希伯来文的意思是 "卖出"
1) 玛拿西的长子
2) 亚米利之子, 为外约旦支派之一的强大的首领, 并成为扫罗和大卫不可或缺的帮助

vocabinfos.mediumDef:
A man living at the time of United Monarchy, first mentioned at 2Sa.9.4;
son of: Ammiel (H5988H)
§ Machir = "sold"
1) eldest son of Manasseh by an Aramite or Syrian concubine and progenitor of a large family
2) son of Ammiel, a powerful chief of one of the Transjordanic tribes who rendered essential services to Saul and to David
